Quote: Everyone's life is a warfare, and that long and various.
Enjoy the sound of silence.
Do not wait for anybody or anything. Do whatever you can. Build your hope on none.
Eveyone we meet is either a lesson or a gift. Move forward accordingly.
It's better to have loved and lost that to stay home every night and download increasingly shameful pornography.
Sometimes it's not the people who change, it's the mask that falls off.
Without music, life would be a mistake.
Don't waste your time worrying about other people--unless it affects the common good. It will keep you from doing anything useful.
Author: Marcus Aurelius

Quote: Everyday it gets a little bit easier. But you gotta do it everyday that's the hard part. But it does get easier.
Author: Bojack Horseman

Quote: There are four elements: earth, wind, fire, water...Therefore playing with your iPhone is the same as playing with dirt...We are god's iPhone
Author: Kanye West

Quote: I would rather die of passion then die of boredom
Author: Vincent Van Gogh

Quote: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak
Author: Sun Tzu

Quote: If you don't heal what hurt you, you'll bleed on people who didn't cut you
Author: Unknown

Quote: You must concentrate upon and consecrate yourself wholly to each day, as though a fire were raging in your hair
Author: Taisen Deshimaru

Quote: Everyone is always telling me to cut my circles smaller, but he who travels alone travels faster, but he who travels with others travels farther
Author: Nick Diaz

Quote: There is no greater agony than bearing an untold story inside you
Author: Maya Angelou

Quote: Men in general are quick to believe that which they wish to be true
Author: Julius Ceaser

Quote: Talent hits a target no one else can hit. Genius hits a target noone else can see
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quote: The most efficient way to live reasonably is every morning to make a plan of one's day and every night to examine the results obtained
Author: Alexis Carrel

Quote: We will never have a perfect world, but it's not romantic or naive to work toward a better one.
Author: Steven Pinker
